features: ♪Mini Ukulele Toy:Perfect introduction to teach kids about the world of music.Teaches young kids about basic rhythm, strumming, and other musical techniques.Encourages children to develop auditory and creativity skills

♪Safe Ukulele Toy for kids:Made from environmental friendly ABS plastic material.Four carbon nylon strings, not easy to break,coating surface design prevents fingers being hurt,does no harm to little kids’ body

♪Light-weighted and simple musical instrument.Small size and easy to carry.Your child will love the ability to strum away to their favorite songs.This Ukulele toy can stimulate children through every stage of development and help cultivate their sense of music, learn basic notes and rhythmic patterns, and put on a show for their favorite audience

♪Interactive Ukulele toy:Sturdy ukulele for young hands yet, fully playable as well as easily tuned.This ukulele offers the realistic feel of a more professional instrument, while remaining kid-friendly for little artists. Your child will love discovering their musical interests, and parents will enjoy time they spend teaching their kids about rhythm, composition, strumming, and other musical techniques

♪Perfect Gift Ideal:Best choice for Christmas, Birthday gift and for party. With this delightful mini ukulele toy,toddlers and big kids alike can enjoy making beautiful music. This best-selling ukulele is the perfect size for younger children to begin developing their musical aptitude

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: This ukulele is the perfect toy for younger children to begin developing their musical aptitude. Best choice for Christmas, birthday gifts and for the party

Ukulele Guitar Toy What is nicer than making music? Guitars, pianos, metallophones and other toy instruments for a lot of fun and musical developmentThis toy guitar is both fun, educational and an ideal musical instrument to use for developing children's hand-eye coordination and encouraging musical creativityLight-weighted - small size - easy to carry: a good toy for outside or travel. With this delightful mini ukulele toy, toddlers and big kids alike can enjoy making beautiful music

Best choice for Christmas, Birthday gifts and for the party Perfect size for kids' hands. Optimized for play by toddlers and younger children Small size and easy to carry, the kids can carry their own instruments around With this delightful mini ukulele toy, toddlers and big kids alike can enjoy making beautiful music

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just what I was looking for. A durable and instrument for my toddler vs the toys that light up. Makes perfect guitar sounds and the pick is attached so will never be lost! So far great purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A NICE INTRODUCTION!
reviews.reviewText: This is a very nice guitar for kids. A great way to introduce a child to a instrument. Sad that seems to be a lost art.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to drive my mom nuts 😂 it's working. When I got it out of the package the bar was broken but it still plays.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not very resistant
reviews.reviewText: It's a pretty good looking and classic toy intrusment to intertain toddlers that love music. I bought 2 for my boys and they loved it but it didn't last mote than 2 months. The string kept coming out and they were getting frustrated every time . I had to hide it so I won't have to fix it every 2 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not a real musical instrument
reviews.reviewText: I guess this is just for display but I can't imagine a scenario where you would need to display a ukulele that's not playable. Body is made of plastic and the strings cannot be tuned. Instead of 4 separate strings that runs from the keys all the way to the bridge, they used 2 long ones and just looped it by the bridge. So if you tighten one string, the string next to it tightens too.I don't even have a picture of it cause I threw it right away. Just a waste of time, money, and I'm pretty sure I've just contributed to the world's problem of plastic pollution.I would definitely discourage people from buying this product. .. get something that says it's made of wood.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my 2 year old
reviews.reviewText: My daughter had shown interest in my guitars, so I wanted to get her a stringed instrument but I wanted something for her that didn’t have a lot of string tension in case the string popped. It’s all hard plastic, so it has held up to a toddler throwing it around and has yet to break or crack after a few months of play. Can’t speak to the quality of actually playing it as I’ve never tuned it to actual play.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy for sure
reviews.reviewText: I’m not a musician so is this like—a great guitar sound quality-wise? Probably not.Does my daughter love it and slightly abuse it? Yep. Does it still work like before? Yess it does. Does she play with it often? Yes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Broken upon arrival
reviews.reviewText: When I bought this for my son for Christmas I was beyond excited! Perfect size for a toddler. But I noticed something was wrong when I got the package cause I heard rattling. But I forgot about it and proceeded to wrap it up for Christmas.Well I went ahead and had my kids open one gift today to get it out of their systems and I let him open this one. Upon opening the guitar we noticed some cracks and that one of the strings weren’t even attached. The ‘tuner’ piece was in the hole of the guitar and upon examining further it had snapped the plastic pieces that’s supposed to keep the string attached and tuned.Yes, the guitar is plastic not wood (not durable plastic either). It would’ve been a great gift if it didn’t arrive already broken.(Pictures are of after we tried to ‘Jerry Rig’ it)Very disappointing
